source: Atlanta Zoning Ordinance (Municode) - Verified from official text
status: VERIFIED - Extracted from official Atlanta Zoning Ordinance

zoning_rules.notes: Most restrictive single-family residential zone. Minimum lot frontage: 200 feet.
Single-family detached homes on one-acre lots. Minimum lot frontage: 150 feet.
Allows accessory dwelling units (ADUs). Minimum lot frontage: 70 feet.
Allows single-family, two-family dwellings, and accessory dwelling units. Zero-lot-line development permitted. Minimum lot frontage: 50 feet. For duplexes: maximum FAR 0.60.

notes: Data extracted from official Atlanta Zoning Ordinance text (Municode)
FAR = Floor Area Ratio (building area / lot area)
Setbacks are minimum required distances from property lines
Parking requirements are per dwelling unit for residential uses
R-5 district allows two-family dwellings and accessory dwelling units
All residential districts have maximum building height of 35 feet
Lot coverage percentages are maximum allowed building footprint as percentage of lot area
